translations: v.以高人一等的态度对待；（经常）惠顾（商店等）；资助（patronise 的现在分词，patronise 等于 patronize）
adj.自认为高人一等的（等于 patronizing）

phrs.translation: 丢人, 以恩人自居的

sentences.sentence: But it did not need the patronising charity of white people.
sentences.translation: 但是，这并不需要白人傲慢的仁慈。

sentences.sentence: Why should I give my patronising colleague the benefit of the doubt when he was so clearly in the wrong?
sentences.translation: 为什么我应该在我高傲的同事显然有错时，却对他“无罪推定”？

sentences.sentence: Whether he comes to you in anger or merely to give you a patronising pat on the back, you are done for, cracked in either case.
sentences.translation: 他是生气地冲你走过来还是仅仅在你的后背屈尊俯就地拍一拍，不管在哪种情况下，你都完蛋了。
